results.title: At the Foot of the Arapiles
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. Even though locals consider it to be full of ‘climbers’ and ‘arty-types’, they recognise Natimuk, in western Victoria, as an active and diverse community and wouldn’t have it any other way.
results.description: Meet the business owners and locals who call Natimuk home and wouldn’t want to live anywhere else. results.title: The Gift
results.brief_description: Deanna is given a real gift in life, this gift is really challenging but as she begins to understand the nature of this gift she understands its true importance.

results.title: The Godfather [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Albert Ruddy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s epic masterpiece features Oscar winner Marlon Brando as the patriarch of the Corleone family. Coppola paints a chilling portrait of a Sicilian family’s rise and near fall from power in America, and the passage of rites from father to son. He masterfully balances the story between family life and the ugly business of crime in which they are engaged. Based on Mario Puzo’ best selling novel, this graphic and brilliant film garnered ten Academy Award nominations. Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Stephanie Moore
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.
results.description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.

results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: Newstead Community Garden
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the town of Newstead held a summit in 2008, the idea of a community garden grew out of it. With the help of a grant and the support of locals and volunteers, the land surrounding the All Saints Anglican Church has become a thriving biodynamic garden. It is a great place for the community to come together, dig and get to know one another.

results.title: Honore et labore
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Diffey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Rhonda Diffey attended her high school reunion, she met two ex-students Frank Spik and Win Ellis both from classes of 1916 and 1915 respectively. Their stories have instilled in Diffey a glimpse into the past and a sense of pride in her school.

results.title: Being positive
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Heather Ellis
results.brief_description: A sensitive and warmly told story by Heather Ellis, mother and wife, diagnosed HIV positive in 1997 upon returning to Australia from a trip to Africa. Heather’s greatest fear is the stigma which may be attached to her son Ethan who is HIV negative but yet she feels privileged that medication is available in Australia for recovery and prevention of positive babies being born. In Africa they do not have this privilege.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: Remembering
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Laura Brearley’s dear friend died of cancer, Brearley took solace in her art, her music and remembering. In doing this, Brearley gave the gift of comfort to many others.
